You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE CMS
Create and Clone Content in a CMS Workspace

Create original or clone existing content. Content is specific to the workspace, and you create it in the default language for the workspace.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions


USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To create workspaces and channels in the Digital Experiences app:	
Modify All Data
OR Create CMS Workspaces and Channels

To manage workspace details, content, contributors, languages, and channels in a Salesforce CMS workspace:	
Assigned a content admin role in that CMS workspace
AND, if adding Experience Cloud site channels, Create and Set Up Experiences

To only manage content within a Salesforce CMS workspace:	Assigned a content manager role in that CMS workspace

The procedure to add content to a CMS workspace is different from the procedure to add content to an enhanced CMS workspace. In an enhanced CMS workspace, you can make copies of a new or existing content record of any type, including the content's variants.

In Lightning Experience, from the App Launcher, open the Digital Experiences app (previously named Salesforce CMS).
To add content to a CMS workspace, follow these steps.
Open the CMS workspace, and then click Add Content.
Select the content type, and then click Create.
Fill in the fields.
To add a source file for document and image content types, upload a file or insert a link from a URL.
NOTE When you link to an image or document source with an external URL, make sure that your org supports the domain used for the URL. Review the Content Security Policy (CSP) settings in Setup, and add the domain of the hosted content to your org’s trusted URL list. If you don’t add the domain to this list, it can raise security alerts for your Experience Cloud site, and users can’t access or preview the content.
Click Save Draft.
Your content is added to the CMS workspace. To make it available to your CMS channels, publish the content.
To add content to an enhanced CMS workspace, follow these steps.
Open the enhanced CMS workspace.
Click Add +, then select Content.
Select the content type, then click Create.
The CMS content editor opens.
Fill in the fields.
If you leave the API name field blank, Salesforce creates an API name for you. You can’t change the API name after you save the content.
To add a source file for document and image content types, drag a file into the source field, upload a file, or insert a link from a URL.
NOTE When you link to an image or document source with an external URL, make sure that your org supports the domain used for the URL. Review the Content Security Policy (CSP) settings in Setup, and add the domain of the hosted content to your org’s trusted URL list. If you don’t add the domain to this list, it can raise security alerts for your Experience Cloud site, and users can’t access or preview the content.
Save your content.
Your content is added to the enhanced CMS workspace. To make it available to your CMS channels, publish the content.
To clone content and content variants in an enhanced CMS workspace, follow these steps.
From the content detail page in your enhanced CMS workspace, click Clone.
Or, from the row-level actions in the workspace’s content list, select Clone.
